abstract.para: &product; comes with a number of preconfigured system roles for HPC. These roles provide a set of preselected packages typical for the specific role, as well as an installation workflow that will configure the system to make the best use of system resource based on a typical role use case.

sect1.title: Installation and Upgrade
sect1.para: This section includes information related to the installation and the upgrade of the &product; &this-version;.

sect2.title: System Role for &product; &this-version;
sect2.para: With &product; &this-version;, it is possible to choose specific roles for the system based on modules selected during the installation process. When the HPC Module is enabled, these three roles are available:

listitem.para: This role includes the following features:
Uses XFS as the default root file system
Installs controller for the Slurm Workload Manager
Mounts a large scratch partition to /var/tmp
This role includes the following features:
Uses XFS as the default root file system
Installs client for the Slurm Workload Manager
Does not create a separate home partition
Mounts a large scratch partition to /var/tmp

sect2.para: The scratch partition /var/tmp/ will only be created if there is sufficient space available on the installation medium (minimum 32 GB).
The Environment Module Lmod will be installed for all roles. It is required at build time and run time of the system.
All libraries specifically build for HPC will be installed under /usr/lib/hpc. They are not part of the standard search path, thus the Lmod environment module system is required.
Munge authentication is installed for all roles. This requires to copy the same generated munge keys to all nodes of a cluster. For more information, see .

From the Ganglia monitoring system, the data collector ganglia-gmod is installed for every role, while the data aggregator ganglia-gmetad needs to be installed manually on the system which is expected to collect the data.
The system roles are only available for new installations of &product;.
